title: New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art Invests Millions in Junk Bonds
text:
The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City recently bought into a firm that is investing in junk bonds.

The Met, one of the largest art museums in the world, disclosed earlier this month that it acquired 1 million units of interest in New Mountain Guardian III BDC, a limited-liability company that was formed in May. The museum’s 1 million units, priced at $10 each, represent a $10 million investment and 10.13% stake in New Mountain Guardian III, according to a form the Met filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
